article.description: Bryson Scott scored a career-high 24 points and Mo Evans added 23 points and 10 assists as Fort Wayne beat Miami (Ohio) 87-71 on Saturday for the Mastodons' sixth consecutive victory.
article.headline: Scott, Evans lead Fort Wayne to 6th straight win
article.linkText: Scott, Evans lead Fort Wayne to 6th straight win
article.story: FORT WAYNE, Ind. -- Bryson Scott scored a career-high 24 points and Mo Evans added 23 points and 10 assists as Fort Wayne beat Miami (Ohio) 87-71 on Saturday for the Mastodons' sixth consecutive victory. John Konchar added 14 points and 12 rebounds and Kason Harrell 11 points. Evans had five 3-pointers and Scott and Harrell three apiece for Fort Wayne (7-2), which made 12 of 20 from the arc for 60 percent, better than the 50 percent (30 of 60) the Mastodons shot overall. Fort Wayne has attempted 20 or more 3-pointers in eight of their nine games. Logan McLane and Marcus Weathers had 13 points each for the RedHawks (4-4), who had a two-game win streak snapped. Fort Wayne scored the first seven points of the game and never trailed, building a 16-point halftime lead with 14 points from Evans and 10 from Scott. The lead remained in double figures in the second half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
